intro: Poterium sanguisorba var. verrucosum, commonly known as rough betony, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of violet or blue flowers. Its distinctive appearance and ecological value make it a notable species in its native environments.
